intro: Melampodium nelsonii, commonly known as the yellow coneflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its bright yellow ray florets and dark brown disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. Melampodium nelsonii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
